intro: Dendrobium cochinchinense, commonly known as the Cochin China orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic plant that grows on trees and rocks, typically in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, yellow, and pink. Its pseudobulbs store water and nutrients, adapting it to its often-dry environments. The leaves are usually elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in photosynthesis.
